CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant received from the local authority in the village of NORP a plot of land which she still uses . She was not , however , given title to the land , so in DATE she requested the local authority to transfer title to her .

CARDINAL . On DATE her request was turned down . She then brought court proceedings for the annulment of that decision and an order requiring the local authority to grant her title to the land . She explained that she continued to use it but needed a document proving her ownership .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG granted her request and ordered the local authority to transfer title to her . No appeal was lodged and the judgment became final and enforceable DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant obtained a warrant of execution which she lodged with ORG of ORG ( “ the GPE ” ) on DATE . On DATE the ORG requested the local authority to comply with the warrant .

CARDINAL . According to documents submitted by the Government , on DATE the local authority annulled its decision of CARDINAL DATE and granted the applicant title to the land . According to the applicant , she was not informed of that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s representative asked for the ORG ’s assistance in enforcing the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . In a letter to the applicant dated DATE , the ORG informed her that on DATE the warrant of execution had been served on the NORP local authority , but that the authority had still not complied with the judgment . ORG also informed the applicant that it was preparing documents with a view to inviting the court to penalise those responsible for the failure to comply with the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s representative again asked for the ORG ’s assistance in enforcing the judgment of DATE . It is unclear whether he received any answer .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG branch of ORG issued the applicant with the cadastral plan of the land . On DATE the applicant paid for the registration of her title at ORG in GPE .
CARDINAL . Following a request on CARDINAL DATE , the applicant obtained registration of her title to the land on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG asked ORG for information about the date and number of the registration of the applicant ’s title to the land .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law has been set out in GPE v. GPE ( no . MONEY , ECHR CARDINALIII ( extracts ) ) .
CARDINAL . In addition , the relevant provisions of LAW ( no . CARDINAL of DATE , which has been in force since DATE ) read as follows :
“ Enforcement proceedings shall be discontinued when :
( a ) the judgment has been enforced ... ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) Decisions to suspend or discontinue enforcement proceedings shall be taken by the head of the enforcement office , after the creditor and debtor have been notified . The absence of the creditor or debtor shall not prevent the adoption of such decisions .

... ( CARDINAL ) The decision to suspend or discontinue the enforcement proceedings shall , within DATE from its adoption , be served on the parties and the authority which issued the warrant of execution ... ”
